edu.caltech.sbw
Class DataBlockWriter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.DataBlockWriter
public final class DataBlockWriter
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements low-level API methods for writing the data portion of a message. The data portion is the application-specific content sent by one application to another, and excludes the message wrapper (which is comprised of data about the source of a message, its destination, etc.). The message wrapper is under control of SBW and is handled transparently to applications.

In the SBW Java interface, the message data block is accessible at the application level only in two contexts:

  • As one of the arguments to SBWLowLevel.call(int moduleTo, int service, int method, DataBlockWriter args). This the synchronous message-sending operation available through the low-level API in SBW.

  • As the value returned by Receiver.receive(int fromModule, int service, int method, DataBlockReader args). This is the class and method that a module must supply to send and receive messages if the module is being defined using the low-level API in SBW.
DataBlockWriter content can be added by using one of the overloaded add methods described below.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Andrew Finney, $Author: mhucka $
See Also:
DataBlockReader, SBWLowLevel, Receiver

add

public void add(java.lang.Object o)
         throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException
Adds a single object to the message data block underlying this particular DataBlockWriter. The object is converted to the underlying SBW data type before being added. The object must be of one of the following Java types or a 1-D or 2-D array of one of these types:
  • String
  • int
  • Integer
  • double
  • Double
  • byte
  • Byte
  • boolean
  • Boolean
  • List (where the list contents are one of the data types listed here, or 1-D or 2-D arrays of these types, potentially including more lists)

Parameters:
o - the object to add
Throws:
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if the given object is not one of the types supported by SBW for conversion.

addOutOfCollection

public void addOutOfCollection(java.util.Collection c)
                        throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException
Adds each of the elements of a Java Collection individually into the message block type. Each object in the collection is converted to the underlying SBW data type before being added. This may provide a convenient interface for constructing a message containing more than one element.

This method is not synchronized.

Parameters:
c - the Collection to add to the message data block
Throws:
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if the given object is not one of the types supported by SBW for conversion. See add(Object o) for a list of supported types.
See Also:
add(Object o)

add

public void add(java.util.Collection c)
         throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException
Adds a Java Collection as an SBW list of items into the message data block underlying this particular DataBlockWriter. Each object in the collection is converted to the underlying SBW data type before being added. The message recipient will see the contents as a list.

Parameters:
c - the Collection to add to the message data block
Throws:
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if the given object is not one of the types supported by SBW for conversion. See add(Object o) for a list of supported types.
See Also:
add(Object o)

add

public void add(java.util.Collection[] a)
         throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException
Adds a 1-D array of Java Collections into the message data block underlying this particular DataBlockWriter. The array of Collections is turned into an array of SBW lists in the message. Each object in the collection is converted to the underlying SBW data type before being added.

Parameters:
a - the array of Collections to add to the message data block
Throws:
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if the given object is not one of the types supported by SBW for conversion. See add(Object o) for a list of supported types.
See Also:
add(Object o)

add

public void add(java.util.Collection[][] a)
         throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException
Adds a 2-D array of Java Collections into the message data block underlying this particular DataBlockWriter. The array of Collections is turned into an array of SBW lists in the message. Each object in the collection is converted to the underlying SBW data type before being added.

Parameters:
a - the array of Collections to add to the message data block
Throws:
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if the given object is not one of the types supported by SBW for conversion. See add(Object o) for a list of supported types.
See Also:
add(Object o)

release

public void release()
Indicate that this data block will no longer be used and may be safely reclaimed.
